tit.cmt: 括弧内を小文字にしました。

sen.j: 常装束（つねしょうぞく）は、舞楽で最も普通に使われる衣装一式。
sen.e: "Tsune-shozoku" means a set of most ordinary costumes worn by performers of bugaku (traditional Japanese court music accompanied by dancing on stage.)
Tsune-shozoku means a set of most ordinary costumes worn by performers of bugaku (traditional Japanese court music accompanied by dancing on stage.)
Tsune-shozoku means a set of most ordinary costumes worn by performers of bugaku (traditional Japanese court music accompanied by dancing on stage).
sen.cmt: ピリオドを括弧の外側に移動しました。

sen.j: 正式には襲装束（かさねしょうぞく）と言う。
sen.e: Its official name is "Kasane-shozoku."
Its official name is Kasane-shozoku.
Its official name is Kasane-shozoku.
sen.cmt: イタリックの箇所を変更しました。

tit.cmt: コロンを削除しました。

sen.e: Okuchi (a hakama skirt, divided and pleated skirt for men, with the wide bottom):
Okuchi (a hakama skirt, divided and pleated skirt for men, with a wide bottom):
Okuchi (a hakama skirt, divided and pleated skirt for men, with a wide bottom):
sen.cmt: イタリックの箇所を変更しました。

sen.e: It is a red hakama skirt with wide open hems at the bottom.
It is a red hakama skirt with wide open hems at the bottom.
It is a red hakama skirt with wide open hems at the bottom.
sen.cmt: イタリックの箇所を変更しました。

sen.j: 表袴（うえのはかま）の下に履くもの。
sen.e: It is worn as an underwear of ue-no-hakama (upper hakama skirt.)
It is worn as underwear of ue-no-hakama (upper hakama skirt.)
It is worn as underwear of ue no hakama (upper hakama skirt).
sen.cmt: ピリオドを括弧の外側に移動しました。

sen.e: Sashinuki no Hakama (a hakama skirt with wringed hems):
Sashinuki no Hakama (a hakama skirt with wringed hems):
Sashinuki no hakama (a hakama skirt with wringed hems):
sen.cmt: hakama 小文字にしました。

sen.j: 平絹や綾などで布八枚分の幅に仕立てた袴。
sen.e: It is a kind of hakama skirt tailorted very wide using eight pieces of plain silk or twilled silk cloths.
It is a kind of hakama skirt tailorted very wide using eight pieces of plain silk or twilled silk cloths.
It is a kind of hakama skirt tailored very wide using eight pieces of plain silk or twilled silk cloths.
sen.cmt: イタリックの箇所を変更しました。

sen.e: When wearing, its hems at the bottom are wringed.
When wearing, its hems at the bottom are wringed.
When wearing, its hems at the bottom are wringed.
It is called "kukurio no hakama" (a hakama skirt with hem tying strings.)
It is called kukurio no hakama (a skirt with hem-tying strings.)
It is called kukurio no hakama (a skirt with hem-tying strings).
sen.cmt: ピリオドを括弧の外側に移動しました。

sen.e: Hitoe (unlined garment):
Hitoe (unlined garment):
Hitoe (unlined garment):
sen.cmt: イタリックの箇所を変更しました。

sen.e: It is a red underwear without lining.
It is a red underwear without lining.
It is a red underwear without lining.

sen.j: 舞楽用の装束では下襲と一体化している。
sen.e: As a costume for bugaku dancing, this underwear is united with shita-gasane (a long inner robe.)
As a costume for bugaku dancing, this underwear is united with shita-gasane (a long inner robe.)
As a costume for bugaku dancing, this underwear is united with shitagasane (a long inner robe.)
sen.cmt: shitagasane ハイフンを削除しました。

sen.e: Shita-gasane (a long inner robe):
Shita-gasane (a long inner robe):
Shitagasane:
sen.cmt: 既出のため、補足を削除しました。

sen.j: 半臂（はんぴ）の下に着る裾（きょ/後ろに引く尾のような部分）の長い衣装。
sen.e: This is a long inner robe with trailing hems, to be worn under hanpi (sleeveless body wear.)
This is a long inner robe with trailing hems, to be worn under hanpi (sleeveless body wear.)
This is a long inner robe with trailing hems, to be worn under hanpi (sleeveless body wear).
sen.cmt: ピリオドを括弧の外側に移動しました。

sen.e: Hanpi (sleeveless body wear):
Hanpi (sleeveless body wear):
Hanpi:
sen.cmt: 既出のため、補足を削除しました。

sen.j: 袖の無い胴着だが舞楽では豪華に刺繍されており、狭い袖がつく。
sen.e: Although the word "hanpi" means a kind of body wear without sleeves, it is a gorgeously embroidered garment with narrow sleeves when it becomes a costume for bugaku dancing.
Although the word "hanpi" means a kind of body wear without sleeves, when used as a costume for bugaku dancing, it is a gorgeously embroidered garment with narrow sleeves.
Although the word hanpi means a kind of body wear without sleeves, when used as a costume for bugaku dancing, it is a gorgeously embroidered garment with narrow sleeves.
sen.cmt: イタリックの箇所を変更しました。

sen.j: 「忘れ緒」という飾り紐を腰に下げる。
sen.e: A narrow decorative strap called "wasure-o." is hanged from its waist position.
A narrow decorative strap called wasure-o is hung from its waist position.
A narrow decorative strap called 'wasure-o' is hung from its waist position.
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションを追加しました。

sen.e: Ho (a term referred to in the glossary for Japanese-style clothing):
Ho (a term referred to in the glossary for Japanese-style clothing):
Ho (round-necked robe):
sen.cmt: 「和服用語集」はリンク先の表示であるようですので、削除しました。

sen.j: 盤領（ばんりょう/円襟）の上着。
sen.e: "Ho" means a kind of outerwear with banryo/marueri (round collar.)
Ho means a kind of outerwear with banryo/marueri (round collar.)
It is a kind of outerwear with banryo/marueri (round collar).
sen.cmt: 文頭の表現を一部変更しました。

sen.e: Torikabuto (a traditional hat for bugaku players):
Torikabuto (a traditional hat for bugaku players):
Torikabuto (a traditional hat for bugaku players):
sen.cmt: イタリックの箇所を変更しました。

sen.e: This is a kind of decoration worn by a man on his head.
This is a kind of decoration worn by a man on his head.
This is a kind of decoration worn by a man on his head.
Fugake (greaves):
Fugake (greaves):
Fugake (greaves):
sen.cmt: イタリックの箇所を変更しました。

sen.j: 錦で作る脚絆状の脛当て。
sen.e: This term means leg-guards in the shape of gaiters made of brocades.
This term means leg-guards in the shape of gaiters made of brocades.
This term means leg-guards in the shape of gaiters made of brocades.
Shigai (shoes made of silk threads):
Shigai (shoes made of silk threads):
Shigai (shoes made of silk threads):

sen.e: This means shoes made of silk threads.
This means shoes made of silk threads.
This means shoes made of silk threads.

sen.j: 別装束が用意される曲目もある。
sen.e: Some programs of bugaku dance and music may adopt different sets of costumes than the above ordinary one.
Some programs of bugaku dance and music may adopt sets of costumes different from the above ordinary one.
Some programs of bugaku dance and music may adopt sets of costumes different from the above ordinary one.
sen.cmt: イタリックの箇所を変更しました。

sen.e: Ryoto costume (a costume of bugaku players following a formal dress of military officers):
Ryoto costume (a costume of bugaku players following a formal dress of military officers):
Ryoto-shozoku (a costume of bugaku players following a formal dress of military officers):
sen.cmt: 蛮絵装束 と合わせ、Ryoto-shozoku としました。

sen.j: 金襴縁と毛縁のものがある。
sen.e: There are two kinds of such costumes, one bordered with gold brocades and another with furs.
There are two kinds of such costumes, one bordered with gold brocades and another with furs.
There are two kinds of such costumes, one bordered with gold brocades and another with furs.

sen.j: 走り舞など動きの大きい舞の衣装。
sen.e: This costume is used when players perform huge movements like a running dance.
This costume is used when players perform huge movements such as a running dance.
This costume is used when players perform huge movements such as a running dance.

sen.j: 裲襠という貫頭衣をつけて、袖を手首で括る。
sen.e: Thus, bugaku players wear kantoi (simple type of clothing consisting of a large piece of cloth with a hole in the middle for the head) that is called "ryoto," with cuffs of sleeves tied at wrists.

Thus, bugaku players wear kantoi (simple type of clothing consisting of a large piece of cloth with a hole in the middle for the head) that is called "ryoto," with cuffs of the sleeves tied at the wrists.

Thus, bugaku players wear kantoi (simple type of clothing consisting of a large piece of cloth with a hole in the middle for the head) that is called ryoto, with cuffs of the sleeves tied at the wrists.
sen.cmt: ダブルクォーテーションを削除しました。

sen.e: Bane-shozoku (a costume including a ho outerwear that has embroideries of bane pictures, a kind of pictures of animals, on it):
Bane-shozoku (a costume including a ho outerwear that has embroideries of bane pictures, a kind of pictures of animals, on it):
Bane-shozoku (a costume including a ho outerwear that has embroideries of bane pictures, a kind of pictures of animals, on it):
sen.cmt: イタリックの箇所を変更しました。

sen.j: 随人という下級武官の衣装の褐衣（かちえ/胸に蛮絵を墨で描いた動きやすい装束）に準じる。
sen.e: This costume corresponds to the clothing of "kachie" (a mobile costume with bane, pictures of animals, printed on its outwear's chests) designed for junior class military officers called "zuijin" (literally, "people from Chinese dynasty of Sui.")

This costume corresponds to the clothing of kachie (a mobile costume with bane, pictures of animals, printed on its outwear's chests) designed for junior class military officers called zuijin (literally, "people from Chinese dynasty of Sui.")

This costume corresponds to the clothing of kachie (a mobile costume with bane, pictures of animals, printed on its outerwear's chests) designed for junior class military officers called zuijin (literally, "people from Chinese dynasty of Sui").
sen.cmt: ピリオドを括弧の外側に移動しました。スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 巻纓冠（けんえいかん/纓と言う後ろの飾りを巻き上げた冠）をかぶる。
sen.e: A crown of "kenei-kan" (a crown with a rolled-up rear decorative band called "ei") is worn together.
A crown of kenei-kan (a crown with a rolled-up rear decorative band called ei) is worn in combination.
A crown of kenei-kan (a crown with a rolled-up rear decorative band called ei) is worn in combination.
sen.cmt: イタリックの箇所を変更しました。
